```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Impacts of investments in conservation-based enterprises and micro-credit interventions in coastal Tanzania",
    "matches_expected_title": "YES"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Pwani Project",
    "country": "Tanzania",
    "region": "Coastal areas near Saadani National Park and Menai Bay Conservation Area",
    "target_population": "Rural coastal communities, including women and individuals with limited access to institutional credit"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "micro-credit and savings support",
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "YES",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "The rural coastal communities in our study area have little access to institutional credit for entrepreneurial activities. [...] Working with the District Cooperative Departments in Pangani, Bagamoyo, and on Zanzibar, the project also established and strengthened savings and credit cooperative organizations (SACCOs) in six villages around Saadani National Park and in two areas on Zanzibar."
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": [
        "livestock keeping",
        "seaweed farming inputs",
        "beekeeping equipment",
        "baking equipment",
        "fuel-efficient stoves",
        "tailoring equipment",
        "solar multi-charger stations",
        "banana and sesame production inputs"
      ],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "Enterprises run by SACCO members included seaweed farming, beekeeping, baking and household food service using fuel-efficient stoves, livestock keeping, tailoring, running shops, best agriculture practices and climate change small doable adaptations, including banana and sesame production."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "number of livelihood activities",
      "total annual income",
      "engagement in extractive activities",
      "household wealth indicators",
      "revenue generated by livelihood activities"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "The research study surveyed Pwani Project beneficiaries and non-beneficiaries to gather qualitative and quantitative data on the total number of livelihood activities, total annual income and indicators of household wealth, average revenue generated by the Pwani livelihood activities, engagement in extractive activities, SACCO loan characteristics, and survey respondent demographics.",
    "study_design": "Observational study with comparison group",
    "design_evidence_citation": "The research study surveyed Pwani Project beneficiaries and non-beneficiaries [...] The beneficiary households engaged in Pwani livelihoods and/or belonging to the SACCOs were randomly selected from the master list of all beneficiaries maintained by Pwani Project personnel. [...] The non-beneficiary households were randomly drawn from the village household lists in proportion to the number of project beneficiaries surveyed in each village.",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2013",
    "sample_size": 295,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": true,
    "qualitative_methods": [
      "open-ended survey questions",
      "Likert scale perception questions"
    ],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": "Likert scale perception questions were added to the survey instrument as a means to further understand project impacts on incomes and extractive livelihoods. [...] All of the responses to the open-ended questions were recorded verbatim in Swahili on the survey instruments and translated into English by one individual to ensure consistent translation.",
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "This paper focuses on the data and findings of the 2013 survey, which delved deeper into understanding the impacts of project-supported livelihoods and micro-credit activities in Tanzania, which were implemented as part of the USAID supported 'Conservation of Coastal Eco-Systems in Tanzania: The Pwani Project.'",
    "country_citation": "This paper focuses on the data and findings of the 2013 survey, which delved deeper into understanding the impacts of project-supported livelihoods and micro-credit activities in Tanzania, which were implemented as part of the USAID supported 'Conservation of Coastal Eco-Systems in Tanzania: The Pwani Project.'",
    "target_population_citation": "The rural coastal communities in our study area have little access to institutional credit for entrepreneurial activities. [...] Working with the District Cooperative Departments in Pangani, Bagamoyo, and on Zanzibar, the project also established and strengthened savings and credit cooperative organizations (SACCOs) in six villages around Saadani National Park and in two areas on Zanzibar."
  }
}
```
